Authors: Hugo Madrid, Josepa Gene, , Josep Cano
Title: Parazalerion gen. et sp. nov.
Abstract:
Parazalerion, a new monotypic fungal genus is described
from Indian soil. The type species, P. indicum, is morphologically
similar to the marine genus Zalerion in the production of helicosporous,
irregularly coiled conidia and knots of thick-walled brown cells. In
contrast to Zalerion, the novel genus is terrestrial and its knots of
cells are produced by the intertwining of groups of conidia, not from a
single conidial filament as in Zalerion. While Zalerion belongs in the
order Halosphaeriales (Sordariomycetes), Parazalerion is probably
related to the phylogenetically distant class Dothideomycetes
